elements.title: Adam Maraana (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Adam Maraana (pictured), an Arab-Israeli, is competing in swimming for Israel at the 2024 Summer Olympics?

elements.title: Diamond Lake, Illinois (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that future American presidential candidate George McGovern was a student pastor at a church in Diamond Lake, Illinois?

elements.title: Stefano Manetti (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Stefano Manetti was co-consecrated a bishop by the same man who ordained him a priest 30 years earlier?

elements.title: the Solomon Islands delegation (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a law was signed so that the Solomon Islands delegation could return home from the 2020 Summer Olympics?

elements.title: an animated kids show (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first lady of the Ivory Coast created an animated kids show in 1989?

elements.title: Victor Alvares de Oliveira (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Olympic fencer Victor Alvares de Oliveira was told at a young age by doctors that he had little chance to compete in the sport due to his severe asthma?

elements.title: a museum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the site of the headquarters of the German colonization of Texas was converted into a museum?

elements.title: Papua New Guinean art (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that artifacts of Papua New Guinean art were called "living spirits with fixed abodes"?
